attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Has Working directory, Has command line arguments, Icon number=341, ctime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, mtime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, atime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, length=0, window=hide

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects a suspiciously big LNK file - maybe with embedded content

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies PowerShell artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies shortcut (LNK) file larger than 100KB. Most goodware LNK files are smaller than 100KB.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Start-Process powershell -WindowStyle hidden -ArgumentList "-WindowStyle Hidden", "-NoLogo", "-NoProfile", "-ExecutionPolicy Bypass", "-EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=18f9eb30-bf20-4fc9-b5c4-0a569877bbe8; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=IEX ([TEXT.ENCOdinG]::UTF8.GEtSTrING((IWr ([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String("aHR0cHM6Ly9jb2NvbWV0aG9kZS5kZS9aZA==")))).CONtENt)); Path=; ScriptBlockId=02ab5ba6-9de3-4a72-983e-c47e3533d2ae; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\i1siylgo\i1siylgo.cmdline; EventID=11}
@{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\x4az3jqa\x4az3jqa.cmdline; EventID=11}
